title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation between Denmark and India on Intellectual Property Rights, phase I

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Intellectual Property Rights aims to strengthen the protection of the Intellectual Property Rights system in India for the benefit of innovation and sustainable economic growth by:
-Strengthening institutional, technical and administrative capacity for examination and registration, -Increasing awareness and strengthened enforcement of rights -Improving framework for commercialization of rights. As a tangible result, the cooperation is expected to pave the way for a bilateral green Patent Prosecution Highway

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Intellectual Property Rights is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Patent and Trademark Office and the Indian Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade. Through the project, the Indian department will strengthen the link between solid framework conditions for Intellectual Property Rights and the promotion of innovation, economic growth and the green transition in India.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.
